intro: Tovomita mangle, commonly known as the mangrove apple, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in saline and brackish water environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by water. Tovomita mangle plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting marine biodiversity.
